articles.headline: Las Vegas Raiders QB Aidan O'Connell exits with wrist injury
articles.description: Following a 10-play, 32-yard scoring drive in the second quarter, Las Vegas Raiders backup quarterback Aidan O'Connell left the club's preseason finale against the Arizona Cardinals on Saturday at State Farm Stadium after sustaining a right wrist injury.

articles.headline: The 49ers spoil Trey Lance's return to the Bay Area with a 30-23 win over the Chargers
articles.description: — Trey Lance's return to the Bay Area led to three straight punts for the Los Angeles Chargers, who went on to lose 30-23 Saturday night to the San Francisco 49ers in the final exhibition game for both teams.

images.name: Curtis Robinson takes it to the house
images.caption: Curtis Robinson comes up with a pick-six to give the 49ers a 23-16 lead.

articles.headline: 2025 NFL preseason Week 3: Analysis, 53-man roster projections
articles.description: The final games of the 2025 preseason help flesh out key battles ahead of Tuesday's 53-man roster cuts.

images.name: Shavers Bills Bucs [608x342]
images.caption: Buffalo Bills wide receiver Tyrell Shavers scores past Tampa Bay Buccaneers cornerback Bryce Hall.

images.name: Bill Barnwell: Brian Robinson gives 49ers peace of mind
images.caption: Bill Barnwell sees a lot of upside in the 49ers' trade for running back Brian Robinson Jr.

articles.headline: San Francisco 49ers final 2025 projected roster
articles.description: The 49ers open the 2025 NFL season at the Seahawks on Sept. 7.

images.name: Why Orlovsky is hesitant about the 49ers this season
images.caption: Dan Orlovsky joins "The Pat McAfee Show" to break down the 49ers' prospects heading into the season.

articles.headline: Los Angeles Chargers final 2025 projected roster
articles.description: The Los Angeles Chargers open the 2025 NFL regular season against the Kansas City Chiefs on Sept. 5 in Sao Paulo, Brazil

images.name: Tim Hasselbeck: Losing Rashawn Slater a huge deal for Chargers
images.caption: Tim Hasselbeck breaks down what Rashawn Slater's season-ending injury means for Justin Herbert and the Chargers.

articles.headline: Tua Tagovailoa throws TD pass and is sacked twice as Dolphins beat Jaguars 14-6 to wrap preseason
articles.description: — Tua Tagovailoa threw a 25-yard touchdown pass and was sacked twice in his only action of the preseason, and the Miami Dolphins beat the Jacksonville Jaguars 14-6 on Saturday night.

images.name: Dolphins top Jaguars 14-6 in preseason finale
images.caption: Tua Tagovailoa throws a 25-yard touchdown pass, leads Miami to a 14-6 preseason victory over Jacksonville.

article.headline: Lions QB Kyle Allen, rookie WR Isaac TeSlaa solidify roster chances in 26-7 preseason loss to Texans
article.description: — The Detroit Lions believe they have found the backup quarterback and depth receiver they were looking for this preseason.
article.linkText: Lions QB Kyle Allen, rookie WR Isaac TeSlaa solidify roster chances in 26-7 preseason loss to Texans

images.name: Juwann Winfree gains big yardage for Texans
images.caption: Graham Mertz spots an open Juwann Winfree and airs one out for a big Texans gain vs. the Lions.

video.headline: Juwann Winfree gains big yardage for Texans
video.caption: Graham Mertz spots an open Juwann Winfree and airs one out for a big Texans gain vs. the Lions.
video.title: Juwann Winfree gains big yardage for Texans
video.description: Graham Mertz spots an open Juwann Winfree and airs one out for a big Texans gain vs. the Lions.

tracking.trackingName: NFL_One-Play (Juwann Winfree gains big yardage for Texans) 2025/08/23 ESHEET

article.story: DETROIT -- — The Detroit Lions believe they have found the backup quarterback and depth receiver they were looking for this preseason. Kyle Allen threw a 33-yard, go-ahead touchdown pass late in the first quarter to rookie Isaac TeSlaa, solidifying their roles with the Lions in a 26-7 loss against the Houston Texans in the preseason on Saturday. “I was pleased with both of those guys,” Detroit coach Dan Campbell said. “It’s good to see Kyle really take it to where he’s gone.” Allen has established himself as Jared Goff's backup, beating out Hendon Hooker, and TeSlaa earned a spot in the receiver rotation behind Amon-Ra St. Brown and Jameson Williams. Detroit drafted the 6-foot-4, 214-pound TeSlaa in the third round even though he had just 28 catches for 545 yards and three touchdowns last season for Arkansas and he has validated the franchise’s faith in him. TeSlaa produced in practices as well as games, with 10 receptions for 146 yards and three touchdowns. “There’s a place for him to help us early in this season,” Campbell said. Texans rookie Graham Mertz, meanwhile, made a bid to earn a spot on a 53-man roster or at least an invite to be on a practice team. “I'm really proud of Graham with the way he commanded the offense," Houston coach DeMeco Ryans said. "He was under control. He did a really nice job of moving the ball up and down the field.” Mertz was 14 of 16 for 145 yards with a 6-yard touchdown pass to former Lions receiver Quintez Cephus in the second quarter. He ran two times for 20 yards. “You want to give the coaches that confidence anytime you step out there that you can go out there and execute when your number is called,” said Mertz, a former Florida and Wisconsin quarterback. Kedon Slovis, who was on Houston's practice squad last year as a rookie, completed 11 of 16 passes for 111 yards with a 3-yard touchdown pass to Daniel Jackson in the fourth quarter. The Texans (2-1) kept C.J. Stroud on the sideline, a week after he led two drives in a preseason win over Carolina, and did not play No. 2 quarterback Davis Mills. Mertz made the most of the opportunity, showing he could make plays with his right arm and legs. The 29-year-old Allen has started 19 times, including twice with the Texans in 2022, and played in 31 games over seven seasons with Carolina, Washington, Houston, Buffalo and Pittsburgh. He threw 17 touchdowns and 16 interceptions in 12 starts for the Panthers in 2019, the only season he played extensively. Allen, who was 5 of 5 for 66 yards and a score on Saturday, completed 35 of 44 passes for 401 yards with five touchdowns and two interceptions in four preseason games. Detroit (1-3) took Hooker in the third round out of Tennessee in 2023, hoping he would eventually become Goff's backup. Hooker didn't throw a touchdown pass in the preseason and threw his third interception of the preseason in the fourth quarter against Houston. Injury report Texans linebacker Jake Hansen was injured in the first quarter, but was able to walk off the field. Campbell said Lions linebacker Ezekiel Turner, who played in nine games last season in Detroit and has 90 NFL games of experience, had an injury that “didn't look good,” during the game. Up next Texans: Start season Sept. 7 at the Los Angeles Rams. Lions: Open season Sept. 7 at Green Bay. ------ AP NFL: https://apnews.com/hub/nfl
